intro: Piper ceylanicum, commonly known as the Ceylon long pepper, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sparsely branched stems and compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into elongated, curved berries containing aromatic seeds. The fruit is harvested when it turns red, and the dried seeds are used as a spice and traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species in both culinary and medicinal contexts.
